sen.j: 松岡 恕庵（まつおか じょあん、寛文8年（1668年） - 延享3年7月11日 (旧暦)（1746年8月27日））は、日本の儒家、本草学者。
sen.e: Joan MATSUOKA (1668 to August 27, 1764) was a Japanese Confucianist and scholar of herbalism.
sen.cmt: 延享3年7月11日は西暦1746年8月27日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Joan MATSUOKA (1668 - August 27, 1764) was a Japanese Confucian and scholar of herbalism.
sen.cmt: 年号を「to」ではなく「ー」で結びました。
sen.e: Joan MATSUOKA (1668 - August 27, 1764) was a Japanese Confucian and scholar of herbalism.

sen.j: 名は玄達（げんたつ）、通称は恕庵、字は成章、号 (称号)は怡顔斎 (いがんさい)、苟完居(こうかんきょ)、埴鈴翁、真鈴潮翁。
sen.e: His name was Gentatsu, common name was Joan, azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Seisho, and aliases were Igansai, Kokankyo, 埴鈴翁 and 真鈴潮翁.
sen.cmt: 埴鈴翁、真鈴潮翁：読みが特定できません。
sen.e: His name was Gentatsu, common name was Joan, azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Seisho, and aliases were Igansai, Kokankyo, Hanisuzuou and Shinrinchoou.
sen.cmt: 埴鈴は埴輪の鈴（素焼きの鈴）ですので「はにすず」と読みます。真鈴潮翁について調べると、「填鈴翁」という字もあり、この場合音読みで「てんりんおう」ではないかと思います。とすると、「真鈴翁」ならば「しんりんおう」であると思われ、音訓混ぜることはないと推定すると「真鈴潮翁」は「しんりんちょうおう」ではないかと推測しました。「埴鈴」は日本古代からある土鈴です。特に京都では古代の形に近い形で今でもよく売られているもので一般的です。ある記述では如庵は垂加神道を学んだ後「真鈴潮翁」を名乗ったとあるので、京都出身の如庵が次第に学を得、土の鈴から本当の鈴になったという意味か、先述の「填鈴翁」のように空の鈴が「いっぱいに詰まった」状態になったという意味があると思います。
sen.e: His name was Gentatsu, common name was Joan, azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Seisho, and aliases were Igansai, Kokankyo, Hanisuzuou and Shinrinchoou.

sen.j: 門弟に小野蘭山、戸田旭山、服部艸玄、浅井図南、谷川士清、横地島狄子、直海元周。
sen.e: His disciples were Ranzan ONO, Kyokuzan TODA, Sogen HATTORI, Tonan ASAI, Kotosuga TANIGAWA, Totekishi YOKOCHI, and 直海元周.
sen.cmt: 直海元周：読みが特定できません。
sen.e: His disciples were Ranzan ONO, Kyokuzan TODA, Sogen HATTORI, Tonan ASAI, Kotosuga TANIGAWA, Totekishi YOKOCHI, and Genshu NAOMI.
sen.cmt: 直海元周ですが、本名は直海龍で、字が元周のようです。学者ですしその字ですので多分音読みで、「げんしゅう」だと思います。
sen.e: His disciples were Ranzan ONO, Kyokuzan TODA, Sogen HATTORI, Tonan ASAI, Kotosuga TANIGAWA, Totekishi YOKOCHI, and Genshu NAOMI.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 恕庵は寛文8年（1668年）京都に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto in 1668.
He was born in Kyoto in 1668.
He was born in Kyoto in 1668.

sen.j: 18歳の時、浅井周伯の私塾・養志堂に入り東洋医学を学びながら、儒学を山崎闇斎、伊藤仁斎に学んだ。
sen.e: At 18, he entered Yoshido, which was a private school of Shuhaku AZAI, to study traditional Chinese medicine, while studying Confucianism under Ansai YAMAZAKI and Jinsai ITO.

At the age of 18, he entered a private school called Yoshido run by Shuhaku AZAI to study traditional Chinese medicine, while he also studied Confucianism under Ansai YAMAZAKI and Jinsai ITO at the same time.
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞による挿入・文章の細分化を避けました。whileに続く分節を文にし、whileの前の文と同位の比較対象となるようにしました。
sen.e: At the age of 18, he entered a private school called Yoshido run by Shuhaku AZAI to study traditional Chinese medicine, while he also studied Confucianism under Ansai YAMAZAKI and Jinsai ITO at the same time.

sen.j: しかし中華人民共和国の詩編「詩経」に出てくる動植物の名の理解に苦しみ本草学者稲生若水の門に入り本草学を学んだ。
sen.e: However, he had difficulties understanding the names of animals and plants described in 'Shikyo' (Chinese Poetry book), which was a book of songs written in the People's Republic of China, he became a disciple of Jakusui Ino, who was a herbalist, to study herbalism.
sen.cmt: 中華人民共和国：原文ママ訳出としています。
sen.e: He also became a disciple of a herbalist Jakusui Ino to study herbalism, after he found difficulties for understanding the names of animals and plants described in Chinese poetry book, 'Shikyo.'
sen.cmt: 原文の語順から英文として通じやすい語順になおしています。「中華人民共和国の詩編」のくだりは「現在中国に残っている」の意味を持たせてのことだと思いますが、それでもこれは「。。。」ですね。この修正文では単に「中国の詩編」としましたので、原文との大きな齟齬はないと思います。
sen.e: He also became a disciple of a herbalist Jakusui Ino to study herbalism, after he found difficulties for understanding the names of animals and plants described in Chinese poetry book, 'Shikyo.'

sen.j: この時から本草学に傾倒していき、のちに自身も本草学を講じるようになった。
sen.e: From around that time he gradually gravitated to herbalism and started teaching the subject in later years.
Since Joan started learning herbalism under Jakusui, he gradually gravitated toward this field of study, and later he himself began to teach herbalism to disciples.
sen.cmt: 「この時から」は訳文の要ではなく再記述したほうが一般的な英文になると思います。また、「started teaching」は文が分割されないまま「From around that time」の分節に含まれていながら、「in later years」としており、時間の指定に問題があります。文章を分割し、この点はっきりさせました。
sen.e: Since Joan started learning herbalism under Jakusui, he gradually gravitated toward this field of study, and later he himself began to teach herbalism to disciples.

sen.j: 享保元年（1716年）徳川吉宗が8代目将軍就任。
sen.e: In 1716, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA became the eighth shogun.
In 1716, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA became the eighth shogun.
In 1716, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA became the eighth shogun.

sen.j: 享保の改革の中で薬事に関する改革を始める。
sen.e: During Kyoho-no-kaikaku (Kyoho reform), he launched medicinal reform.
During Kyoho-no-kaikaku (Kyoho reform), Yoshimune launched medicinal reform.
sen.cmt: 如庵の項目の中で別人物が主語になっていますので、「he」の代名詞ではなく記述しました。
sen.e: During Kyoho-no-kaikaku (Kyoho reform), Yoshimune launched medicinal reform.

sen.j: この時はまだ、江戸幕府開幕後も日本の文化中心地は京都であり本草学の中心地もまた京都であった。
sen.e: Even after the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was established, the cultural center of Japan was still Kyoto at the time, including herbalism.

At the time Yoshimune started the reform, the cultural center of Japan including the herbalism study ground was still in Kyoto, which had not been changed yet since the establishment of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 原文がおかしく、時制関係がしっかりしていません。訳文は原文の真意からずれ、「この時はまだ」の最重要部分がきちんと訳されていないように思います。「吉宗が薬事の改革を始めた時に至ってもまだ文化中心は京都だった]、という意味となるよう修正しました。
sen.e: At the time Yoshimune started the reform, the cultural center of Japan including the herbalism study ground was still in Kyoto, which had not been changed yet since the establishment of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: そのため享保6年（1721年）江戸の本草学発展の為の人材として恕庵ら京都の本草学者が幕府からの招聘を受け京都から幕府の江戸医学館に招かれた。
sen.e: Therefore, in order to acquire experts to develop herbalism in Edo, the bakufu invited Joan and other herbalists from Kyoto to Edo Igakukan (Medical School in Edo).
Therefore, Edo bakufu invited Joan and other herbalists from Kyoto to Edo Igakukan (Medical School in Edo) in order to acquire experts to develop herbalism in Edo.
sen.cmt: これも語順の修正です。「in order to-」の分節が「Therefore,」の接続詞に続かないよう、次の文章と反転させました。
sen.e: Therefore, Edo bakufu invited Joan and other herbalists from Kyoto to Edo Igakukan (Medical School in Edo) in order to acquire experts to develop herbalism in Edo.

sen.j: 恕庵は集められた本草の薬事検査をする和薬改会所に加わり検査法を検討した。
sen.e: Joan entered Wayaku Aratamekaisho (an evaluation institute for Japanese traditional medicine), where pharmaceutical research on collected herbs is conducted, to study test methods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理和薬改会所：定訳は確認できません。
sen.e: Joan joined Wayaku Aratamekaisho (an evaluation institute for Japanese traditional medicine) to investigate on the examination methods of collected herb samples for pharmaceutical research.
sen.cmt: 「ーに加わり」は「enter」より「join」などの方が一般的です。「検討した」も、研究・検査のための検査方法の検討ということで、本来の検査を「study」とした際に重複しないよう、「investigate」としました。
sen.e: Joan joined Wayaku Aratamekaisho (an evaluation institute for Japanese traditional medicine) to investigate on the examination methods of collected herb samples for pharmaceutical research.

sen.j: 飢饉のための対策、殖産産業に寄与し日本の本草学を発展させた。
sen.e: He developed Japanese herbalism by contributing to develop measures against famine and encouraging industry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Through the progress of his study in the field of herbalism, Joan contributed for the development of measures against famine and the growth of various industries in Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文が単純に2つの別の意味の文章を一つにし、その関係を明らかにしていないのがまず問題なのですが、それにより直訳した訳文の意味もまたよくわかりません。何が文章内で重要なのかがはっきりしていないためだと思います。ここでは、「日本の本草学を発展させることで、飢饉の対策や殖産産業の発展に寄与した」と主従関係をもたせ、意訳しています。
sen.e: Through the progress of his study in the field of herbalism, Joan contributed for the development of measures against famine and the growth of various industries in Japan.

sen.j: 延享3年（1746年）死去。
sen.e: He died in 1764.
He died in 1764.
He died in 1764.

sen.j: 享年79。
sen.e: He died at the age of 79.
He died at the age of 79.
He died at the age of 79.

sen.j: 功績
sen.e: Achievement
Achievement
Achievement

sen.j: 師の稲生若水は中国の本草学を日本の本草学に変えていく草分けとして以後の本草学を発展させる人材を輩出した。
sen.e: Jakusui INOU, who was his master, was a forerunner who developed Japanese harbalism based on Chinese harbalism, and instructed scholars who would further develop herbalism in the future.

Joan's teacher, Jakusui INOU, was a forerunner in the field of Japanese herbalism who transformed Chinese herbalism into the study suitable for Japanese environment; he instructed scholars who would further develop herbalism in the future.
sen.cmt: 「中国の本草学を日本の本草学に変えていく」の意味が訳文では欠落しています。「中国のものをベースに日本のものを」となっていて間違いではないでしょうが、より原文に近いものに修正しました。原文は2文でしたので、「；」で分割しています。
sen.e: Joan's teacher, Jakusui INOU, was a forerunner in the field of Japanese herbalism who transformed Chinese herbalism into the study suitable for Japanese environment; he instructed scholars who would further develop herbalism in the future.

sen.j: だが、恕庵の本草学はそれまでの薬学に重きを置くものに収まらず、積極的に多種多様の動植物、鉱物を収集し博物学的なものに発展していた。
sen.e: However, Joan's herbalism not only valued conventional pharmacy, but went beyond the category into a kind of natural history, by actively collecting a wide range of animals, plants and minerals.

However, Joan's study in herbalism could not be contained within the conventional herbalism to focus on pharmacy, and he developed his study toward natural history by actively collecting a wide range of sample animals, plants and minerals for further investigation.
sen.cmt: 訳者は「not only-but (also)」構文を用い用としていますが、成功していません。より単純な構成としました。原文では「如庵の本草学はそれまでの薬学に重きを置くものに収まらず」となっているところを訳文は意訳して「如庵の本草学はそれまでの薬学を重視しただけでなく」となっており、原文で「薬学偏重」に批判的な態度があるように取れるところを訳文では積極的に認める」という意味に変えており、ズレがあると思います。この点踏まえて修正しました。
sen.e: However, Joan's study in herbalism could not be contained within the conventional herbalism to focus on pharmacy, and he developed his study toward natural history by actively collecting a wide range of sample animals, plants and minerals for further investigation.

sen.j: それは、門弟小野蘭山が築く日本国本草学、丹羽正伯の検査基準「和薬種六ヶ條」に結実していくことになった。
sen.e: His efforts ultimately brought herbalism of Japan established by Ranzan ONO, who was his disciple, and 'Wayakushu Rokkajo' (Six articles on Japanese medicine) by Shohaku NIWA, which defined test standards.

Joan's efforts were succeeded among his deciples, ultimately realized as the methodology of herbalism in Japan established by Ranzan ONO, and 'Wayakushu Rokkajo' (Six articles on Japanese medicine) testing methodology and standard established by Shohaku NIWA.
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞による細分化を避けました。（訳文では4分節のところ修正で２分節）如庵の成果と区別するため、さらに発展したという意味を加えました。（methodology等の語を追加）
sen.e: Joan's efforts were succeeded among his deciples, ultimately realized as the methodology of herbalism in Japan established by Ranzan ONO, and 'Wayakushu Rokkajo' (Six articles on Japanese medicine) testing methodology and standard established by Shohaku NIWA.
